info.title: Trieve API
info.description: Trieve OpenAPI Specification. This document describes all of the operations available through the Trieve API.

put.description: This route allows you to send CTR data to the system.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to send CTR data

204.description: The CTR data was successfully sent

400.description: Service error relating to sending CTR data

get.description: This will redirect you to the OAuth provider for authentication with email/pass, SSO, Google, Github, etc.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID of organization to authenticate into

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: URL to redirect to after successful login

parameters.name: inv_code
parameters.description: Code sent via email as a result of successful call to send_invitation

303.description: Response that redirects to OAuth provider through a Location header to be handled by browser.

400.description: OAuth error likely with OIDC provider.

delete.description: Invalidate your current auth credential stored typically stored in a cookie. This does not invalidate your API key.

204.description: Confirmation that your current auth token has been invalidated. This does not invalidate your API key.

get.description: This is the callback route for the OAuth provider, it should not be called directly. Redirects to browser with set-cookie header.

200.description: Response that returns with set-cookie header

400.description: Email or password empty or incorrect

get.description: Get the user corresponding to your current auth credentials.

200.description: The user corresponding to your current auth credentials

400.description: Error message indicitating you are not currently signed in

post.summary: Create or Upsert Chunk or Chunks
post.description:
Create new chunk(s). If the chunk has the same tracking_id as an existing chunk, the request will fail. Once a chunk is created, it can be searched for using the search endpoint.
If uploading in bulk, the maximum amount of chunks that can be uploaded at once is 120 chunks. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to create a new chunk (chunk)

200.description: JSON response payload containing the created chunk

400.description: Error typically due to deserialization issues

413.description: Error when more than 120 chunks are provided in bulk

426.description: Error when upgrade is needed to process more chunks

put.description: Update a chunk. If you try to change the tracking_id of the chunk to have the same tracking_id as an existing chunk, the request will fail. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a chunk (chunk)

204.description: No content Ok response indicating the chunk was updated as requested

400.description: Service error relating to to updating chunk, likely due to conflicting tracking_id

post.description: This route provides the primary autocomplete functionality for the API. This prioritize prefix matching with semantic or full-text search.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: X-API-Version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this request. Defaults to V2 for orgs created after July 12, 2024 and V1 otherwise.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to semantically search for chunks (chunks)

200.description: Chunks with embedding vectors which are similar to those in the request body

400.description: Service error relating to searching

post.description: This route can be used to determine the number of chunk results that match a search query including score threshold and filters. It may be high latency for large limits. There is a dataset configuration imposed restriction on the maximum limit value (default 10,000) which is used to prevent DDOS attacks. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to count chunks for a search query

200.description: Number of chunks satisfying the query

post.description: This endpoint exists as an alternative to the topic+message resource pattern where our Trieve handles chat memory. With this endpoint, the user is responsible for providing the context window and the prompt and the conversation is ephemeral.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to perform RAG on some chunks (chunks)

200.description: This will be a JSON response of a string containing the LLM's generated inference. Response if not streaming.

TR-QueryID.description: Query ID that is used for tracking analytics

400.description: Service error relating to to updating chunk, likely due to conflicting tracking_id

post.description: Get recommendations of chunks similar to the positive samples in the request and dissimilar to the negative.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: X-API-Version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this request. Defaults to V2 for orgs created after July 12, 2024 and V1 otherwise.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get recommendations of chunks similar to the chunks in the request

200.description: Chunks with embedding vectors which are similar to positives and dissimilar to negatives

400.description: Service error relating to to getting similar chunks

post.description: This route provides the primary search functionality for the API. It can be used to search for chunks by semantic similarity, full-text similarity, or a combination of both. Results' `chunk_html` values will be modified with `<b><mark>` tags for sub-sentence highlighting.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: X-API-Version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this request. Defaults to V2 for orgs created after July 12, 2024 and V1 otherwise.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to semantically search for chunks (chunks)

200.description: Chunks with embedding vectors which are similar to those in the request body

400.description: Service error relating to searching

post.description: This endpoint will generate 3 suggested queries based off a hybrid search using RAG with the query provided in the request body and return them as a JSON object.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get alternative suggested queries

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of alternative suggested queries

400.description: Service error relating to to updating chunk, likely due to conflicting tracking_id

put.description: Update a chunk by tracking_id. This is useful for when you are coordinating with an external system and want to use the tracking_id to identify the chunk. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a chunk by tracking_id (chunks)

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk has been updated as per your request

400.description: Service error relating to to updating chunk

get.description: Get a singular chunk by tracking_id. This is useful for when you are coordinating with an external system and want to use your own id as the primary reference for a chunk.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: X-API-Version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this request. Defaults to V2 for orgs created after July 12, 2024 and V1 otherwise.

parameters.name: tracking_id
parameters.description: tracking_id of the chunk you want to fetch

200.description: chunk with the tracking_id that you were searching for

400.description: Service error relating to fidning a chunk by tracking_id

delete.description: Delete a chunk by tracking_id. This is useful for when you are coordinating with an external system and want to use the tracking_id to identify the chunk. If deleting a root chunk which has a collision, the most recently created collision will become a new root chunk. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: tracking_id
parameters.description: tracking_id of the chunk you want to delete

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk with the tracking_id specified was deleted

400.description: Service error relating to finding a chunk by tracking_id

get.description: Get a singular chunk by id.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.description: The API version to use for this request. Defaults to V2 for orgs created after July 12, 2024 and V1 otherwise.

parameters.name: chunk_id
parameters.description: Id of the chunk you want to fetch.

200.description: chunk with the id that you were searching for

400.description: Service error relating to fidning a chunk by tracking_id

delete.description: Delete a chunk by its id. If deleting a root chunk which has a collision, the most recently created collision will become a new root chunk. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: chunk_id
parameters.description: Id of the chunk you want to fetch.

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk with the id specified was deleted

400.description: Service error relating to finding a chunk by tracking_id

post.summary: Create or Upsert Group or Groups
post.description: Create new chunk_group(s). This is a way to group chunks together. If you try to create a chunk_group with the same tracking_id as an existing chunk_group, this operation will fail. Only 1000 chunk groups can be created at a time. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to cretea a chunk_group(s)

200.description: Returns the created chunk_group if a single chunk_group was specified or an array of all chunk_groups which were created

400.description: Service error relating to creating the chunk_group(s)

413.description: Service error indicating more 1000 chunk groups are trying to be created at once

put.description: Update a chunk_group. One of group_id or tracking_id must be provided. If you try to change the tracking_id to one that already exists, this operation will fail. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to update a chunkGroup

204.description: Confirmation that the chunkGroup was updated

400.description: Service error relating to updating the chunkGroup

post.description: Route to add a chunk to a group. One of chunk_id or chunk_tracking_id must be provided. Auth'ed user or api key must have an admin or owner role for the specified dataset's organization.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Id of the group to add the chunk to as a bookmark

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to add a chunk to a group (bookmark it)

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk was added to the group (bookmark'ed).

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in.

delete.description: Route to remove a chunk from a group. Auth'ed user or api key must be an admin or owner of the dataset's organization to remove a chunk from a group.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Id of the group you want to remove the chunk from.

parameters.name: chunk_id
parameters.description: Id of the chunk you want to remove from the group

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to remove a chunk from a group

204.description: Confirmation that the chunk was removed to the group

400.description: Service error relating to removing the chunk from the group

post.description: Route to get the groups that a chunk is in.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get the groups that a chunk is in

200.description: JSON body representing the groups that the chunk is in

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in

post.description: This route allows you to get groups as results instead of chunks. Each group returned will have the matching chunks sorted by similarity within the group. This is useful for when you want to get groups of chunks which are similar to the search query. If choosing hybrid search, the results will be re-ranked using scores from a cross encoder model. Compatible with semantic, fulltext, or hybrid search modes.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: X-API-Version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this request. Defaults to V2 for orgs created after July 12, 2024 and V1 otherwise.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to semantically search over groups

200.description: Group chunks which are similar to the embedding vector of the search query

400.description: Service error relating to searching over groups

post.description: Route to get recommended groups. This route will return groups which are similar to the groups in the request body. You must provide at least one positive group id or group tracking id.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: X-API-Version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this request. Defaults to V2 for orgs created after July 12, 2024 and V1 otherwise.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to get recommendations of chunks similar to the chunks in the request

200.description: JSON body representing the groups which are similar to the positive groups and dissimilar to the negative ones

400.description: Service error relating to to getting similar chunks

post.description: This route allows you to search only within a group. This is useful for when you only want search results to contain chunks which are members of a specific group. If choosing hybrid search, the results will be re-ranked using scores from a cross encoder model.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

parameters.name: X-API-Version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this request. Defaults to V2 for orgs created after July 12, 2024 and V1 otherwise.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to semantically search a group

200.description: Group chunks which are similar to the embedding vector of the search query

400.description: Service error relating to getting the groups that the chunk is in

200.description: chunks with the id that you were searching for

400.description: Service error relating to fidning a chunk by tracking_id

404.description: Any one of the specified chunks not found

post.description: Get paginated chunks from your dataset with filters and custom sorting. If sort by is not specified, the results will sort by the id's of the chunks in ascending order. Sort by and offset_chunk_id cannot be used together; if you want to scroll with a sort by then you need to use a must_not filter with the ids you have already seen. There is a limit of 1000 id's in a must_not filter at a time.

parameters.name: TR-Dataset
parameters.description: The dataset id or tracking_id to use for the request. We assume you intend to use an id if the value is a valid uuid.

requestBody.description: JSON request payload to scroll through chunks (chunks)

200.description: Number of chunks equivalent to page_size starting from offset_chunk_id

400.description: Service error relating to scrolling chunks

post.description: This route allows you to view the number of items in each queue in the Prometheus format.

200.description: Prometheus metrics for the server

chunk_id.description: Id of the chunk to make a member of the group.

chunk_tracking_id.description: Tracking Id of the chunk to make a member of the group.

inv_code.description: Code sent via email as a result of successful call to send_invitation

organization_id.description: ID of organization to authenticate into

redirect_uri.description: URL to redirect to after successful login

content_only.description: Set content_only to true to only returning the chunk_html of the chunks. This is useful for when you want to reduce amount of data over the wire for latency improvement (typically 10-50ms). Default is false.

extend_results.description: If specified to true, this will extend the search results to include non-exact prefix matches of the same search_type such that a full page_size of results are returned. Default is false.

page_size.description: Page size is the number of chunks to fetch. This can be used to fetch more than 10 chunks at a time.

query.description: Query is the search query. This can be any string. The query will be used to create an embedding vector and/or SPLADE vector which will be used to find the result set.

remove_stop_words.description: If true, stop words (specified in server/src/stop-words.txt in the git repo) will be removed. Queries that are entirely stop words will be preserved.

score_threshold.description: Set score_threshold to a float to filter out chunks with a score below the threshold. This threshold applies before weight and bias modifications. If not specified, this defaults to 0.0.

slim_chunks.description: Set slim_chunks to true to avoid returning the content and chunk_html of the chunks. This is useful for when you want to reduce amount of data over the wire for latency improvement (typically 10-50ms). Default is false.

use_quote_negated_terms.description: If true, quoted and - prefixed words will be parsed from the queries and used as required and negated words respectively. Default is false.

user_id.description: User ID is the id of the user who is making the request. This is used to track user interactions with the search results.

pos_in_queue.description: The current position the last access item is in the queue

clicked_chunk_id.description: The ID of chunk that was clicked

clicked_chunk_tracking_id.description: The tracking ID of the chunk that was clicked

metadata.description: Any metadata you want to include with the event i.e. action, user_id, etc.

position.description: The position of the clicked chunk

request_id.description: The request id for the CTR data

ChunkFilter.description: Filters is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata.

jsonb_prefilter.description: JOSNB prefilter tells the server to perform a full scan over the metadata JSONB column instead of using the filtered HNSW. Datasets on the enterprise plan with custom metadata indices will perform better with the filtered HNSW instead. When false, the server will use the filtered HNSW index to filter chunks. When true, the server will perform a full scan over the metadata JSONB column to filter chunks. Default is true.

must.description: All of these field conditions have to match for the chunk to be included in the result set.

must_not.description: None of these field conditions can match for the chunk to be included in the result set.

should.description: Only one of these field conditions has to match for the chunk to be included in the result set.

example.description: All versions and colorways of the oversized t-shirt
example.name: Versions of Oversized T-Shirt

example.description: All versions and colorways of the oversized t-shirt
example.name: Versions of Oversized T-Shirt

example.description: All versions and colorways of the slim-fit t-shirt
example.name: Versions of Slim-Fit T-Shirt

chunk_html.description: HTML content of the chunk. This can also be plaintext. The innerText of the HTML will be used to create the embedding vector. The point of using HTML is for convienience, as some users have applications where users submit HTML content.

convert_html_to_text.description: Convert HTML to raw text before processing to avoid adding noise to the vector embeddings. By default this is true. If you are using HTML content that you want to be included in the vector embeddings, set this to false.

group_ids.description: Group ids are the Trieve generated ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to create a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request. Groups with these Trieve generated ids must be created first, it cannot be arbitrarily created through this route.

group_tracking_ids.description: Group tracking_ids are the user-assigned tracking_ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to create a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request. If a group with the tracking_id does not exist, it will be created.

image_urls.description: Image urls are a list of urls to images that are associated with the chunk. This is useful for when you want to associate images with a chunk.

link.description: Link to the chunk. This can also be any string. Frequently, this is a link to the source of the chunk. The link value will not affect the embedding creation.

metadata.description: Metadata is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata.

num_value.description: Num value is an arbitrary numerical value that can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by numerical value. There is no performance hit for filtering on num_value.

semantic_content.description: If semantic_content is present, it will be used for creating semantic embeddings instead of the innerText `chunk_html`. `chunk_html` will still be the only thing stored and always used for fulltext functionality.

split_avg.description: Split avg is a boolean which tells the server to split the text in the chunk_html into smaller chunks and average their resulting vectors. This is useful for when you want to create a chunk from a large piece of text and want to split it into smaller chunks to create a more fuzzy average dense vector. The sparse vector will be generated normally with no averaging. By default this is false.

tag_set.description: Tag set is a list of tags. This can be used to filter chunks by tag. Unlike with metadata filtering, HNSW indices will exist for each tag such that there is not a performance hit for filtering on them.

time_stamp.description: Time_stamp should be an ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone. It is used for time window filtering and recency-biasing search results.

tracking_id.description: Tracking_id is a string which can be used to identify a chunk. This is useful for when you are coordinating with an external system and want to use the tracking_id to identify the chunk.

upsert_by_tracking_id.description: Upsert when a chunk with the same tracking_id exists. By default this is false, and the request will fail if a chunk with the same tracking_id exists. If this is true, the chunk will be updated if a chunk with the same tracking_id exists.

weight.description: Weight is a float which can be used to bias search results. This is useful for when you want to bias search results for a chunk. The magnitude only matters relative to other chunks in the chunk's dataset dataset.

name.description: The name of the topic. If this is not provided, the topic name is the same as the previous topic

owner_id.description: The owner_id of the topic. This is typically a browser fingerprint or your user's id. It is used to group topics together for a user.

limit.description: Set limit to restrict the maximum number of chunks to count. This is useful for when you want to reduce the latency of the count operation. By default the limit will be the number of chunks in the dataset.

score_threshold.description: Set score_threshold to a float to filter out chunks with a score below the threshold. This threshold applies before weight and bias modifications. If not specified, this defaults to 0.0.

use_quote_negated_terms.description: If true, quoted and - prefixed words will be parsed from the queries and used as required and negated words respectively. Default is false.

CrawlInterval.description: Interval at which specified site should be re-scraped

CrawlOpenAPIOptions.title: CrawlOpenAPIOptions
CrawlOpenAPIOptions.description: Options for including an openapi spec in the crawl

openapi_schema_url.description: OpenAPI json schema to be processed alongside the site crawl

openapi_tag.description: Tag to look for to determine if a page should create an openapi route chunk instead of chunks from heading-split of the HTML

CrawlOptions.description: Options for setting up the crawl which will populate the dataset.

allow_backward_links.description: Option for allowing the crawl to navigate from a specific URL to previously linked pages.

allow_external_links.description: Option for allowing the crawl to follow links to external websites.

boost_titles.description: Boost titles such that keyword matches in titles are prioritized in search results. Strongly recommended to leave this on. Defaults to true.

exclude_paths.description: URL Patterns to exclude from the crawl

exclude_tags.description: Specify the HTML tags, classes and ids to exclude from the response.

ignore_sitemap.description: Ignore the website sitemap when crawling, defaults to true.

include_paths.description: URL Patterns to include in the crawl

include_tags.description: Specify the HTML tags, classes and ids to include in the response.

limit.description: How many pages to crawl, defaults to 1000

max_depth.description: How many levels deep to crawl, defaults to 10

group_variants.description: This option will ingest all variants as individual chunks and place them in groups by product id. Turning this off will only scrape 1 variant per product. default: true

example.description: All versions and colorways of the oversized t-shirt
example.name: Versions of Oversized T-Shirt

example.description: All versions and colorways of the slim-fit t-shirt
example.name: Versions of Slim-Fit T-Shirt

tracking_id.description: Optional tracking ID for the dataset. Can be used to track the dataset in external systems. Must be unique within the organization. Strongly recommended to not use a valid uuid value as that will not work with the TR-Dataset header.

server_configuration.MESSAGE_TO_QUERY_PROMPT: Write a 1-2 sentence semantic search query along the lines of a hypothetical response to:
server_configuration.RAG_PROMPT: Use the following retrieved documents to respond briefly and accurately:

concat_user_messages_query.description: If concat user messages query is set to true, all of the user messages in the topic will be concatenated together and used as the search query. If not specified, this defaults to false. Default is false.

new_message_content.description: The content of the user message to attach to the topic and then generate an assistant message in response to.

page_size.description: Page size is the number of chunks to fetch during RAG. If 0, then no search will be performed. If specified, this will override the N retrievals to include in the dataset configuration. Default is None.

score_threshold.description: Set score_threshold to a float to filter out chunks with a score below the threshold. This threshold applies before weight and bias modifications. If not specified, this defaults to 0.0.

search_query.description: Query is the search query. This can be any string. The search_query will be used to create a dense embedding vector and/or sparse vector which will be used to find the result set. If not specified, will default to the last user message or HyDE if HyDE is enabled in the dataset configuration. Default is None.

topic_id.description: The ID of the topic to attach the message to.

user_id.description: The user_id is the id of the user who is making the request. This is used to track user interactions with the RAG results.

name.description: The arbitrary name which will be used to identify the organization. This name must be unique.

description.description: Description to assign to the chunk_group. Convenience field for you to avoid having to remember what the group is for.

metadata.description: Optional metadata to assign to the chunk_group. This is a JSON object that can store any additional information you want to associate with the chunks inside of the chunk_group.

name.description: Name to assign to the chunk_group. Does not need to be unique.

tag_set.description: Optional tags to assign to the chunk_group. This is a list of strings that can be used to categorize the chunks inside the chunk_group.

tracking_id.description: Optional tracking id to assign to the chunk_group. This is a unique identifier for the chunk_group.

upsert_by_tracking_id.description: Upsert when a chunk_group with the same tracking_id exists. By default this is false, and the request will fail if a chunk_group with the same tracking_id exists. If this is true, the chunk_group will be updated if a chunk_group with the same tracking_id exists.

example.description: All versions and colorways of the oversized t-shirt

first_user_message.description: The first message which will belong to the topic. The topic name is generated based on this message similar to how it works in the OpenAI chat UX if a name is not explicitly provided on the name request body key.

The search_query will be used to create a dense embedding vector and/or sparse vector which will be used to find the result set. If not specified, will default to the last user message or HyDE if HyDE is enabled in the dataset configuration. Default is None.

field.description: Field is the name of the field to filter on. The field value will be used to check for an exact substring match on the metadata values for each existing chunk. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. To access fields inside of the metadata that you provide with the card, prefix the field name with `metadata.`.

match_all.description: Match all lets you pass in an array of values that will return results if all of the items match. The match value will be used to check for an exact substring match on the metadata values for each existing chunk. If both match_all and match_any are provided, the match_any condition will be used.

match_any.description: Match any lets you pass in an array of values that will return results if any of the items match. The match value will be used to check for an exact substring match on the metadata values for each existing chunk. If both match_all and match_any are provided, the match_any condition will be used.

FullTextBoost.description: Boost the presence of certain tokens for fulltext (SPLADE) and keyword (BM25) search. I.e. boosting title phrases to priortize title matches or making sure that the listing for AirBNB itself ranks higher than companies who make software for AirBNB hosts by boosting the in-document-frequency of the AirBNB token (AKA word) for its official listing. Conceptually it multiples the in-document-importance second value in the tuples of the SPLADE or BM25 sparse vector of the chunk_html innerText for all tokens present in the boost phrase by the boost factor like so: (token, in-document-importance) -> (token, in-document-importance*boost_factor).

boost_factor.description: Amount to multiplicatevly increase the frequency of the tokens in the phrase by

phrase.description: The phrase to boost in the fulltext document frequency index

chunk_ids.description: The ids of the chunks to be retrieved and injected into the context window for RAG.

frequency_penalty.description: Frequency penalty is a number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim. Default is 0.7.

highlight_results.description: Set highlight_results to false for a slight latency improvement (1-10ms). If not specified, this defaults to true. This will add `<b><mark>` tags to the chunk_html of the chunks to highlight matching splits.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion. Default is None.

presence_penalty.description: Presence penalty is a number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics. Default is 0.7.

prev_messages.description: The previous messages to be placed into the chat history. There must be at least one previous message.

prompt.description: Prompt will be used to tell the model what to generate in the next message in the chat. The default is 'Respond to the previous instruction and include the doc numbers that you used in square brackets at the end of the sentences that you used the docs for:'. You can also specify an empty string to leave the final message alone such that your user's final message can be used as the prompt. See docs.trieve.ai or contact us for more information.

stop_tokens.description: Stop tokens are up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens. Default is None.

stream_response.description: Whether or not to stream the response. If this is set to true or not included, the response will be a stream. If this is set to false, the response will be a normal JSON response. Default is true.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. Default is 0.5.

user_id.description: User ID is the id of the user who is making the request. This is used to track user interactions with the RAG results.

GeoInfo.description: Location that you want to use as the center of the search.

GeoInfoWithBias.description: Location bias lets you rank your results by distance from a location. If not specified, this has no effect. Bias allows you to determine how much of an effect the location of chunks will have on the search results. If not specified, this defaults to 0.0. We recommend setting this to 1.0 for a gentle reranking of the results, >3.0 for a strong reranking of the results.

bias.description: Bias lets you specify how much of an effect the location of chunks will have on the search results. If not specified, this defaults to 0.0. We recommend setting this to 1.0 for a gentle reranking of the results, >3.0 for a strong reranking of the results.

page.description: Page number to return, 1-indexed. Default is 1.

page_size.description: Number of items to return per page. Default is 20.

event_types.description: The types of events to get. Leave undefined to get all events.

page.description: The page number to get. Default is 1.

page_size.description: The number of items per page. Default is 10.

HighlightOptions.description: Highlight Options lets you specify different methods to highlight the chunks in the result set. If not specified, this defaults to the score of the chunks.

highlight_delimiters.description: Set highlight_delimiters to a list of strings to use as delimiters for highlighting. If not specified, this defaults to ["?", ",", ".", "!"]. These are the characters that will be used to split the chunk_html into splits for highlighting. These are the characters that will be used to split the chunk_html into splits for highlighting.

highlight_max_length.description: Set highlight_max_length to control the maximum number of tokens (typically whitespace separated strings, but sometimes also word stems) which can be present within a single highlight. If not specified, this defaults to 8. This is useful to shorten large splits which may have low scores due to length compared to the query. Set to something very large like 100 to highlight entire splits.

highlight_max_num.description: Set highlight_max_num to control the maximum number of highlights per chunk. If not specified, this defaults to 3. It may be less than 3 if no snippets score above the highlight_threshold.

highlight_results.description: Set highlight_results to false for a slight latency improvement (1-10ms). If not specified, this defaults to true. This will add `<b><mark>` tags to the chunk_html of the chunks to highlight matching splits and return the highlights on each scored chunk in the response.

highlight_threshold.description: Set highlight_threshold to a lower or higher value to adjust the sensitivity of the highlights applied to the chunk html. If not specified, this defaults to 0.8. The range is 0.0 to 1.0.

highlight_window.description: Set highlight_window to a number to control the amount of words that are returned around the matched phrases. If not specified, this defaults to 0. This is useful for when you want to show more context around the matched words. When specified, window/2 whitespace separated words are added before and after each highlight in the response's highlights array. If an extended highlight overlaps with another highlight, the overlapping words are only included once. This parameter can be overriden to respect the highlight_max_length param.

use_images.description: This sends images to the llm if chunk_metadata.image_urls has some value, the call will error if the model is not a vision LLM model. default: false

app_url.description: The url of the app that the user will be directed to in order to set their password. Usually admin.trieve.ai, but may differ for local dev or self-hosted setups.

email.description: The email of the user to invite. Must be a valid email as they will be sent an email to register.

redirect_uri.description: The url that the user will be redirected to after setting their password.

user_role.description: The role the user will have in the organization. 0 = User, 1 = Admin, 2 = Owner.

LLMOptions.description: LLM options to use for the completion. If not specified, this defaults to the dataset's LLM options.

completion_first.description: Completion first decides whether the stream should contain the stream of the completion response or the chunks first. Default is false. Keep in mind that || is used to separate the chunks from the completion response. If || is in the completion then you may want to split on ||{ instead.

frequency_penalty.description: Frequency penalty is a number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim. Default is 0.7.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion. Default is None.

presence_penalty.description: Presence penalty is a number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics. Default is 0.7.

stop_tokens.description: Stop tokens are up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens. Default is None.

stream_response.description: Whether or not to stream the response. If this is set to true or not included, the response will be a stream. If this is set to false, the response will be a normal JSON response. Default is true.

system_prompt.description: Optionally, override the system prompt in dataset server settings.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. Default is 0.5.

MultiQuery.description: MultiQuery allows you to construct a dense vector from multiple queries with a weighted sum. This is useful for when you want to emphasize certain features of the query. This only works with Semantic Search and is not compatible with cross encoder re-ranking or highlights.

query.description: Query to embed for the final weighted sum vector.

weight.description: Float value which is applies as a multiplier to the query vector when summing.

QdrantSortBy.description: Sort by lets you specify a method to sort the results by. If not specified, this defaults to the score of the chunks. If specified, this can be any key in the chunk metadata. This key must be a numeric value within the payload.

QueryTypes.description: Query is the search query. This can be any string. The query will be used to create an embedding vector and/or SPLADE vector which will be used to find the result set.  You can either provide one query, or multiple with weights. Multi-query only works with Semantic Search and is not compatible with cross encoder re-ranking or highlights.

RecommendType.description: The type of recommendation to make. This lets you choose whether to recommend based off of `semantic` or `fulltext` similarity. The default is `semantic`.

RecommendationStrategy.description: Strategy to use for recommendations, either "average_vector" or "best_score". The default is "average_vector". The "average_vector" strategy will construct a single average vector from the positive and negative samples then use it to perform a pseudo-search. The "best_score" strategy is more advanced and navigates the HNSW with a heuristic of picking edges where the point is closer to the positive samples than it is the negatives.

SemanticBoost.description: Semantic boosting moves the dense vector of the chunk in the direction of the distance phrase for semantic search. I.e. you can force a cluster by moving every chunk for a PDF closer to its title or push a chunk with a chunk_html of "iphone" 25% closer to the term "flagship" by using the distance phrase "flagship" and a distance factor of 0.25. Conceptually it's drawing a line (euclidean/L2 distance) between the vector for the innerText of the chunk_html and distance_phrase then moving the vector of the chunk_html distance_factor*L2Distance closer to or away from the distance_phrase point along the line between the two points.

distance_factor.description: Arbitrary float (positive or negative) specifying the multiplicate factor to apply before summing the phrase vector with the chunk_html embedding vector

phrase.description: Terms to embed in order to create the vector which is weighted summed with the chunk_html embedding vector

dataset_ids.description: The dataset ids which the api key will have access to. If not provided or empty, the api key will have access to all datasets the auth'ed user has access to. If both dataset_ids and organization_ids are provided, the api key will have access to the intersection of the datasets and organizations.

name.description: The name which will be assigned to the new api key.

organization_ids.description: The organization ids which the api key will have access to. If not provided or empty, the api key will have access to all organizations the auth'ed user has access to.

role.description: The role which will be assigned to the new api key. Either 0 (read), 1 (read and write at the level of the currently auth'ed user). The auth'ed user must have a role greater than or equal to the role being assigned which means they must be an admin (1) or owner (2) of the organization to assign write permissions with a role of 1.

scopes.description: The routes which the api key will have access to. If not provided or empty, the api key will have access to all routes the auth'ed user has access to. Specify the routes as a list of strings. For example, ["GET /api/dataset", "POST /api/dataset"].

api_key.description: The api key which was created. This is the value which should be used in the Authorization header.

pos_in_queue.description: The current position the last access item is in the queue

field.description: Field to sort by. This has to be a numeric field with a Qdrant `Range` index on it. i.e. num_value and timestamp

prefetch_amount.description: How many results to pull in before the sort
How many results to pull in before the rerabj

rerank_query.description: Query to use for prefetching defaults to the search query

SortOptions.description: Sort Options lets you specify different methods to rerank the chunks in the result set. If not specified, this defaults to the score of the chunks.

tag_weights.description: Tag weights is a JSON object which can be used to boost the ranking of chunks with certain tags. This is useful for when you want to be able to bias towards chunks with a certain tag on the fly. The keys are the tag names and the values are the weights.

use_weights.description: Set use_weights to true to use the weights of the chunks in the result set in order to sort them. If not specified, this defaults to true.

context.description: Context is the context of the query. This can be any string under 15 words and 200 characters. The context will be used to generate the suggested queries. Defaults to None.

query.description: The query to base the generated suggested queries off of using RAG. A hybrid search for 10 chunks from your dataset using this query will be performed and the context of the chunks will be used to generate the suggested queries.

TypoOptions.description: Typo Options lets you specify different methods to correct typos in the query. If not specified, typos will not be corrected.

correct_typos.description: Set correct_typos to true to correct typos in the query. If not specified, this defaults to false.

disable_on_word.description: Words that should not be corrected. If not specified, this defaults to an empty list.

prioritize_domain_specifc_words.description: Auto-require non-english words present in the dataset to exist in each results chunk_html text. If not specified, this defaults to true.

TypoRange.description: The TypoRange struct is used to specify the range of which the query will be corrected if it has a typo.

max.description: The maximum number of characters that the query will be corrected if it has a typo. If not specified, this defaults to 8.

min.description: The minimum number of characters that the query will be corrected if it has a typo. If not specified, this defaults to 5.

dataset_config.description: The new configuration for all datasets in the organization. Only the specified keys in the configuration object will be changed per dataset such that you can preserve dataset unique values.

server_configuration.MESSAGE_TO_QUERY_PROMPT: Write a 1-2 sentence semantic search query along the lines of a hypothetical response to:
server_configuration.RAG_PROMPT: Use the following retrieved documents to respond briefly and accurately:

chunk_html.description: HTML content of the chunk you want to update. This can also be plaintext. The innerText of the HTML will be used to create the embedding vector. The point of using HTML is for convienience, as some users have applications where users submit HTML content. If no chunk_html is provided, the existing chunk_html will be used.

convert_html_to_text.description: Convert HTML to raw text before processing to avoid adding noise to the vector embeddings. By default this is true. If you are using HTML content that you want to be included in the vector embeddings, set this to false.

group_ids.description: Group ids are the ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to update a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request.

group_tracking_ids.description: Group tracking_ids are the tracking_ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to update a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request.

link.description: Link of the chunk you want to update. This can also be any string. Frequently, this is a link to the source of the chunk. The link value will not affect the embedding creation. If no link is provided, the existing link will be used.

metadata.description: The metadata is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata. If no metadata is provided, the existing metadata will be used.

time_stamp.description: Time_stamp should be an ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone. It is used for time window filtering and recency-biasing search results. If no time_stamp is provided, the existing time_stamp will be used.

tracking_id.description: Tracking_id of the chunk you want to update. This is required to match an existing chunk.

weight.description: Weight is a float which can be used to bias search results. This is useful for when you want to bias search results for a chunk. The magnitude only matters relative to other chunks in the chunk's dataset dataset. If no weight is provided, the existing weight will be used.

description.description: Description to assign to the chunk_group. Convenience field for you to avoid having to remember what the group is for. If not provided, the description will not be updated.

group_id.description: Id of the chunk_group to update.

metadata.description: Optional metadata to assign to the chunk_group. This is a JSON object that can store any additional information you want to associate with the chunks inside of the chunk_group.

name.description: Name to assign to the chunk_group. Does not need to be unique. If not provided, the name will not be updated.

tag_set.description: Optional tags to assign to the chunk_group. This is a list of strings that can be used to categorize the chunks inside the chunk_group.

tracking_id.description: Tracking Id of the chunk_group to update.

update_chunks.description:
Flag to update the chunks in the group. If true, each chunk in the group will be updated
by appending the group's tags to the chunk's tags. Default is false.

chunk_html.description: HTML content of the chunk you want to update. This can also be plaintext. The innerText of the HTML will be used to create the embedding vector. The point of using HTML is for convienience, as some users have applications where users submit HTML content. If no chunk_html is provided, the existing chunk_html will be used.

chunk_id.description: Id of the chunk you want to update. You can provide either the chunk_id or the tracking_id. If both are provided, the chunk_id will be used.

convert_html_to_text.description: Convert HTML to raw text before processing to avoid adding noise to the vector embeddings. By default this is true. If you are using HTML content that you want to be included in the vector embeddings, set this to false.

group_ids.description: Group ids are the ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to update a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request.

group_tracking_ids.description: Group tracking_ids are the tracking_ids of the groups that the chunk should be placed into. This is useful for when you want to update a chunk and add it to a group or multiple groups in one request.

image_urls.description: Image urls are a list of urls to images that are associated with the chunk. This is useful for when you want to associate images with a chunk. If no image_urls are provided, the existing image_urls will be used.

link.description: Link of the chunk you want to update. This can also be any string. Frequently, this is a link to the source of the chunk. The link value will not affect the embedding creation. If no link is provided, the existing link will be used.

metadata.description: The metadata is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata. If no metadata is provided, the existing metadata will be used.

num_value.description: Num value is an arbitrary numerical value that can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by numerical value. If no num_value is provided, the existing num_value will be used.

tag_set.description: Tag set is a list of tags. This can be used to filter chunks by tag. Unlike with metadata filtering, HNSW indices will exist for each tag such that there is not a performance hit for filtering on them. If no tag_set is provided, the existing tag_set will be used.

time_stamp.description: Time_stamp should be an ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone. It is used for time window filtering and recency-biasing search results. If no time_stamp is provided, the existing time_stamp will be used.

tracking_id.description: Tracking_id of the chunk you want to update. This is required to match an existing chunk.

weight.description: Weight is a float which can be used to bias search results. This is useful for when you want to bias search results for a chunk. The magnitude only matters relative to other chunks in the chunk's dataset dataset. If no weight is provided, the existing weight will be used.

dataset_id.description: The id of the dataset you want to update.

dataset_name.description: The new name of the dataset. Must be unique within the organization. If not provided, the name will not be updated.

new_tracking_id.description: Optional new tracking ID for the dataset. Can be used to track the dataset in external systems. Must be unique within the organization. If not provided, the tracking ID will not be updated. Strongly recommended to not use a valid uuid value as that will not work with the TR-Dataset header.

tracking_id.description: The tracking ID of the dataset you want to update.

server_configuration.MESSAGE_TO_QUERY_PROMPT: Write a 1-2 sentence semantic search query along the lines of a hypothetical response to:
server_configuration.RAG_PROMPT: Use the following retrieved documents to respond briefly and accurately:

description.description: Description to assign to the chunk_group. Convenience field for you to avoid having to remember what the group is for. If not provided, the description will not be updated.

metadata.description: Optional metadata to assign to the chunk_group. This is a JSON object that can store any additional information you want to associate with the chunks inside of the chunk_group.

name.description: Name to assign to the chunk_group. Does not need to be unique. If not provided, the name will not be updated.

tag_set.description: Optional tags to assign to the chunk_group. This is a list of strings that can be used to categorize the chunks inside the chunk_group.

tracking_id.description: Tracking Id of the chunk_group to update.

name.description: The new name of the organization. If not provided, the name will not be updated.
The new name of the topic. A name is not generated from this field, it is used as-is.

topic_id.description: The id of the topic to target.

role.description: Either 0 (user), 1 (admin), or 2 (owner). If not provided, the current role will be used. The auth'ed user must have a role greater than or equal to the role being assigned.

user_id.description: The id of the user to update, if not provided, the auth'ed user will be updated. If provided, the role of the auth'ed user or api key must be an admin (1) or owner (2) of the organization.

base64_file.description: Base64 encoded file. This is the standard base64url encoding.

create_chunks.description: Create chunks is a boolean which determines whether or not to create chunks from the file. If false, you can manually chunk the file and send the chunks to the create_chunk endpoint with the file_id to associate chunks with the file. Meant mostly for advanced users.

description.description: Description is an optional convience field so you do not have to remember what the file contains or is about. It will be included on the group resulting from the file which will hold its chunk.

file_name.description: Name of the file being uploaded, including the extension.

group_tracking_id.description: Group tracking id is an optional field which allows you to specify the tracking id of the group that is created from the file. Chunks created will be created with the tracking id of `group_tracking_id|<index of chunk>`

link.description: Link to the file. This can also be any string. This can be used to filter when searching for the file's resulting chunks. The link value will not affect embedding creation.

metadata.description: Metadata is a JSON object which can be used to filter chunks. This is useful for when you want to filter chunks by arbitrary metadata. Unlike with tag filtering, there is a performance hit for filtering on metadata. Will be passed down to the file's chunks.

rebalance_chunks.description: Rebalance chunks is an optional field which allows you to specify whether or not to rebalance the chunks created from the file. If not specified, the default true is used. If true, Trieve will evenly distribute remainder splits across chunks such that 66 splits with a `target_splits_per_chunk` of 20 will result in 3 chunks with 22 splits each.

split_delimiters.description: Split delimiters is an optional field which allows you to specify the delimiters to use when splitting the file before chunking the text. If not specified, the default [.!?\n] are used to split into sentences. However, you may want to use spaces or other delimiters.

tag_set.description: Tag set is a comma separated list of tags which will be passed down to the chunks made from the file. Tags are used to filter chunks when searching. HNSW indices are created for each tag such that there is no performance loss when filtering on them.

target_splits_per_chunk.description: Target splits per chunk. This is an optional field which allows you to specify the number of splits you want per chunk. If not specified, the default 20 is used. However, you may want to use a different number.

time_stamp.description: Time stamp should be an ISO 8601 combined date and time without timezone. Time_stamp is used for time window filtering and recency-biasing search results. Will be passed down to the file's chunks.

tags.name: Invitation
tags.description: Invitation endpoint. Exists to invite users to an organization.

tags.name: Auth
tags.description: Authentication endpoint. Serves to register and authenticate users.

tags.name: User
tags.description: User endpoint. Enables you to modify user roles and information.

tags.name: Organization
tags.description: Organization endpoint. Enables you to modify organization roles and information.

tags.name: Dataset
tags.description: Dataset endpoint. Datasets belong to organizations and hold configuration information for both client and server. Datasets contain chunks and chunk groups.

tags.name: Chunk
tags.description: Chunk endpoint. Think of chunks as individual searchable units of information. The majority of your integration will likely be with the Chunk endpoint.

tags.name: Chunk Group
tags.description: Chunk groups endpoint. Think of a chunk_group as a bookmark folder within the dataset.

tags.name: File
tags.description: File endpoint. When files are uploaded, they are stored in S3 and broken up into chunks with text extraction from Apache Tika. You can upload files of pretty much any type up to 1GB in size. See chunking algorithm details at `docs.trieve.ai` for more information on how chunking works. Improved default chunking is on our roadmap.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Notifications endpoint. Files are uploaded asynchronously and events are sent to the user when the upload is complete.

tags.name: Topic
tags.description: Topic chat endpoint. Think of topics as the storage system for gen-ai chat memory. Gen AI messages belong to topics.

tags.name: Message
tags.description: Message chat endpoint. Messages are units belonging to a topic in the context of a chat with a LLM. There are system, user, and assistant messages.

tags.name: Stripe
tags.description: Stripe endpoint. Used for the managed SaaS version of this app. Eventually this will become a micro-service. Reach out to the team using contact info found at `docs.trieve.ai` for more information.

tags.name: Health
tags.description: Health check endpoint. Used to check if the server is up and running.

tags.name: Metrics
tags.description: Metrics endpoint. Used to get information for monitoring

tags.name: Analytics
tags.description: Analytics endpoint. Used to get information for search and RAG analytics
